Blood Banana is a limited, multi-harvest, mythical crop added in the Chicken Zombie update.
The Blood Banana looks like a Banana, yet it is peeled slightly and has a reddish-orange inside. A Blood Banana produce is characterized as a long, curved fruit with a yellow peel and red flesh. The seed is a rectangular shape, vertically positioned, and colored yellow (bottom) fading into red (top).
The Blood Banana seed can be found in the Blood moon Shop, and costs 200,000₵ when it is in stock.
The Blood Banana is considered a "Night type fruit"
It is inspired by the Banana from the Exotic Seed Pack

title: Sheckles
question: O que é Sheckles no Grow a Garden?
content:
1 Overview
2 Obtainment
3 Trivia
4 Gallery
Sheckles are the main currency of Grow a Garden.
There is no currently known  Sheckle limit.
A player can earn sheckles by selling crops at the Sell Stuff stand. Some pets, such as the Mole, can provide a player  Sheckles. A player can also get sheckles from the Sheckle Rain.
Another method of earning  Sheckles in this game is by selling pets at the Pet Shop. A player can also sell pets at the Sell Stuff stand.
A player can see how many  Sheckles they have in the bottom left corner of the screen, or by looking at the leaderboard in the top right.
Sheckles are used to buy items from the Seed Shop, Gear Shop, and the Pet Eggs shop.
Sheckles are also used in certain events, like in the Easter Event 2025's Easter Shop, or to restart the Lunar Glow Event's reward track.
Every player's friend in the same server as a player provides them a +10%  Sheckle boost.

title: Take Player’s Fruit
question: O que é Take Player’s Fruit no Grow a Garden?
answer: Stealing/Taking Fruit is one of the developer products a player can purchase to take a crop from someone else’s garden.
content:
Stealing/Taking Fruit is one of the developer products a player can purchase to take a crop from someone else’s garden.
1 General Description
2 Appearance
3 Trivia
4 Gallery
This developer product is used if a player taps collect on a crop from another players farm/garden and purchases the pass. The product is  37 for one stolen crop. After the player purchases the product, the fruit will most likely appear in their inventory. Occasionally, the steal will fail, and the game will take the players Robux then the player will receive 100 back. It also seems that the more expensive a crop gets, the higher the chance of the steal failing. Unlike a raccoon that duplicates a crop, stealing takes it from the players garden.
The developer product.
The developer product icon is a laughing emoji. After the player taps collect on another players fruit it prompts them with a developer product. It costs  37. After a player steals a fruit a heading will appears at the top of the screen for everyone in the server saying “__ (The person stealing) Stole From __ (The person that was stolen from)”.
The Raccoon and Red Fox are the only items/pets in game that can steal items (seeds/crops) from other players also without using robux.

The Bug Egg can be purchased from the Pet Egg stand for  50,000,000 and takes 8 hours to hatch. The chance for the Bug Egg to appear in stock is 3%.
The Exotic Bug Egg hatches in 30 seconds.
The Bug Egg is considered the most valuable egg in the game, which ties with Night Egg.
The Exotic Bug Egg is a type of variant of the Bug Egg which hatches in 30 seconds compared to the 8 hours that a regular Bug Egg takes to hatch.
The Bug Egg when held can boost the player similar to the Celestiberry.
The Exotic Bug Egg, the paid version of the regular Bug Egg, has an offset grip position, being held lower than a regular Bug Egg.

The Moonglow is a mythical, limited, multi-harvest crop. It produces one plant at a time, similar to crops like the Lotus and Foxglove.
The Moonglow crop consists of a crown of green and purple leaves in a nest-like shape, all pointing outward, with the produce in the center. The Moonglow produce is green and egg shaped, and is covered in a transparent neon coating that gives it a neon green glow.
The Moonglow had a 5% chance to be obtained from the Night Seed Pack, and a 12% chance to be obtained from the Premium Night Seed Pack.
Formerly, the Moonglow's seed was shorter than other seeds, while it was missing its neon section. It has since been fixed.
The Moonglow is similar to the Pineapple, being short crops with a crown of leaves that produce one fruit at a time.
If a player touches the Moonglow, it will temporarily light up.
Golden and Chocolate Moonglows have a studded texture that removes the fruit’s neon glow. These are the only mutations that change the texture of the Moonglow.
The Frozen Mutation removes the transparent coating  around a Moonglow, resulting in the fruit losing its glow.
The MoonGlow is considered a "Night type fruit"

The Moon Melon is a limited mythical multi-harvest crop that was released as part of the Chicken Zombie Update on May 17, 2025.
The Moon Melon has a square crimson body with a short, vertical, thick green stem on its top. The Moon Melon seed is a dark peach color.
When in stock, the Moon Melon's seed could be bought from the Blood Moon Shop.
Moon Melons are often used as substitutes for Candy Blossoms.
There is currently a strategy involving spamming sprinklers around the Moon Melon crop and leaving the game for about an hour, and returning to massive fruits, around 30-50kg in size, resulting in sell prices rivaling Candy Blossoms, after applying certain mutations. Hence, it is considered the best fruit for grinding sheckles.
Moon Melons are considered a "Night type" fruit.
Moon Melons (along with Watermelon and Pumpkin) are affected by the Sweet Soaker Sprinkler.

title: Expansions
question: O que é Expansions no Grow a Garden?
answer: As of Update 1.07.0, users can expand their farm using  Sheckles. Users can expand by clicking the signs at the back or the sides, wherever applicable, of their garden. While the side upgrades don't expand much, the back upgrades expand a whole plot (hence the price.) The total cost of all expansions is  2,000,000,000.

The Purple Dahlia is a multi-harvest, limited crop which was introduced during the Bizzy Bee Event in Grow a Garden.
The Purple Dahlia features rich, deep purple petals arranged in a full, layered bloom atop a tall, elegant green stem. Its Mythical rarity is reflected in a faint shimmer or glow, making it stand out vividly among other flowers.

The Purple Dahlia's flower closely resembles the Lotus flower in appearance.

Its seed is used when crafting the Honeysuckle seed.

The Tarantula Hawk is a legendary Pet introduced in the Friendship Update.
The Tarantula Hawk has 28,000 hunger.
The Tarantula Hawk can be obtained from the Anti Bee Egg, which can be bought from the Limited Time Shop for  149 or crafted at the Bizzy Bear for:
1 Bee egg and 25 honey.
The Tarantula Hawk resembles the Wasp, but has a different texture with a blue body and red-yellow wings. It is based off of its living counter part, the tarantula hawk.
Every 25 minutes, the Tarantula Hawk flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated mutation. When pollination occurs, the following message appears: Tarantula Hawk applied Pollinated mutation to the plant.
Every 5 minutes, the Tarantula Hawk stings a random pet and advances its ability cooldown by 80 seconds. If a pet has 2 abilitys, for example another Tarantula Hawk, the message says it reduced the cooldown of the first ability, but it actually reduced the cooldown of both abilities.

The Butterfly is a mythical Pet introduced in the Friendship Update.
The Butterfly has 26.000 hunger.
The Butterfly can be obtained from the Anti Bee Egg, which can be bought from the Limited Time Shop for  149 or crafted at the Bizzy Bear for:
1 Bee Egg + 25 Honey = 1 Anti Bee Egg
The Butterfly has a long, narrow purple body with a slightly rounded head and several small, evenly spaced black legs underneath. Its wings are large and angular, extending outward in a symmetrical "V" shape. Each wing is light purple and decorated with two vertical black rectangles near the center and four orange circular markings closer to the tips. The wings are flat and wide, with sharp corners and a stepped, block-like shape. The entire model has a clean, geometric design that emphasizes symmetry and stylized detail.
Every ~30m, flies to a nearby fruit with 5+ mutations, removes all mutations from it and turns it rainbow! Ignores favorited fruit.
Gold is a Growth Mutation, not an Environmental Mutation so it won't work if it has only 4 Environmental Mutation and 1 Growth Mutation.

The Honeysuckle is a limited, multi-harvest and mythical crop which was introduced in the Bizzy Bee Event.
Honeysuckle is a crop with a short, dark green base comprised of several leaves and a short stem. Honeysuckle produce sits atop the short crop, and appears as a yellow flower in the shape of a six vertices star (otherwise seen as six petals). The middle of the Honeysuckle contains three glowing stamens with each one having a neon anther at the end. Each petal is roughly edged, with a thin and somewhat elongated and drooped pinnacle. Honeysuckle seed a small, vertical, yellow rectangle.
The Honeysuckle was obtained after completing all 30 recipes for Bizzy Bear's quest, only one seed can be obtained per quest-cycle or by crafting.
It is now obtained through the seed crafting area. To craft it requires 1 Pink Lily seed, 1 Purple Dahlia seed and  80.
The Honeysuckle's design originates from a giant Honeysuckle concept made by "JAYE!!!!!!" on Discord. [1]
The Honeysuckle produces 1 flower a time.
The Average KG of the Honeysuckle is 13KG
The minimum KG of a Honeysuckle is ~8.54KG
The Honeysuckle’s minimum value is the same as the Candy Blossom

The Master Sprinkler is 1 of the 6 sprinklers including the Basic Sprinkler, Advanced Sprinkler, Godly Sprinkler, Chocolate Sprinkler, and Honey Sprinkler.
Upon using this, every plant in the radius of the sprinkler will have Increased Crop size, Mutations chances, and faster growth.
The Master Sprinkler has a unique appearance, with green and black colors. It doesn't take an appearance of a circle from a Basic Sprinkler, and Advanced Sprinkler. Instead, it has 3-line water shooters that exit through the sprinkler. Like all other sprinklers, it's base is black.
The Master Sprinkler is a divine gear that is able to be purchased from the Gear Shop for 10,000,000 or  199 and is quite rare for it to be in stock at the gear shop.
It is best to use a Master Sprinkler when planting Mushrooms to increase the chance of Mutations like Rainbow and Golden.
It is the best sprinkler out of all sprinklers. Additionally, its lasting time is doubled, unlike the other obtainable sprinklers, this lasts for 10 Minutes.

The Mango is a multi-harvest, mythical crop.

Has a 1% chance to be in stock in Seed Shop. A user can purchase a seed for  100,000 or  580.

Stolen by a Red Fox
Snail, yield a seed when harvest

Mangoes weighing 14.25 kg or more with no mutations and no multipliers gain value according to the equation:
Value = 29.18x^2 - 10.395x + 91.07, where x is the mass of the fruit in kg.
Mangoes weighing 14.25 kg or less have the minimum value of  5866.
A Mango crop takes about eight minutes to fully grow and produces a mango every two minutes.
The Mango is one of few plants to have a counter part, being the Moon Mango.

The Pet Eggs shop, is one of the main shops in Grow a Garden. The shop is mainly used to sell Pet Egg and help increase pet slots. Raphael used to be the quest giver but that task was changed to the Gear Shop after the Pet Update.
The Pet Shop is one of the stands/shops in Grow a Garden. It holds the Pet Eggs. Every 30 minutes the 3 eggs rotate. At the beginning of the Pet Update the Panda appeared next to it for the first hour of the update for players to obtain.
The stand has a yellow and white striped spawning over it. It is made out of dark wood. On the top it has a wood sign that says “PET EGGS” in yellow text. On the left side it shows a sign above Raphael with the remaining time until the shop refreshes. On the right Raphael stands in his designated spot and on the left there are 3 eggs which rotate every 30 minutes. On the left of the stand there is a stand which refreshes the egg’s for a cost of Robux. It neighbours the Gear Shop.
This button is used if a player wants to get rid of their pet/sell it for money. When the player clicks the button if they are holding out one of their Pets then Raphael will give them the designated money for the pet.
This button is used if a player wants to see how much sheckles their pet will sell for. When they click this button if they are holding out a pet Raphael will tell them the amount the pet is worth.
This button is used if a player wants to learn the information on how to age up pets. After the player clicks this button Raphael will tell them that the player  needs to feed them to increase their hunger and the more time the pet spends in the garden the more it will age up.
This button is used if a player wants to add an extra slot to their pets or eggs in their garden. For this to work, the player must trade in a pet that is age 20 or above. For the first upgrade the player must hand in a level 20 pet, and a level 30 for the second one. For the third and fourth one the player needs a level 45 and 60 pet.
Additionally, players can also view (non-exclusive) pet eggs' rarities via this option.
This button is used if a player accidentally clicks on the talk button to Raphael or they changed their mind.
The stand was added along with the Pet/Animals Update.
Raphael’s Shop (formally just a stand) was the quest giver but became the Pet Shop after the pet update.
The daily quest is now found by talking to Eloise (gear shop) and then pick show me daily quest
The daily quest is now found by talking to Eloise (gear shop) and then pick show me daily quest
By clicking the "Refresh Eggs" sign near the shop, the player can instantly restock all eggs instantly. Usually the shop has a 30 minute cool down on egg refreshes.

By filling his Honey Container to the maximum, the player will receive  10 as a reward. It takes 30 seconds to compress the honey before the player can collect it.
By giving Onett plants that are Pollinated, the player can convert them to  Honey by getting 10kg worth of pollinated plants.
The value of the plant itself doesn't matter—only its weight in kilograms and how much it contributes to the total sum are relevant.
Onett’s appearance is quite simplistic, with a red head, a red right arm, a yellow torso, a pale blue left arm, and 2 pale blue legs with the Roblox Veterans Medal on his torso. His appearances around the game in chronological order is this,
On the DJ Booth
In the Honey Combpressor Booth
Table showing all the possible responses he gives once the player completes his task
Onett is primarily known for his association with the game "Bee Swarm Simulator" and his dialogue makes references to it frequently.
Giving Onett a polinated flower doesn't increase the kilograms filled, even though it's a flower.
Its highly recomended to use fruits that are cheap and avaragely weight, if possible in high ammounts to. For example, coconuts, they are heavy, come in big amounts and are very cheap, meaning that not much money would be lost if not sold.
Onett got a massive buff on June 7th with his compressing time going down from 3 minutes to 30 seconds.
Players can disguise as Onett just with the color. The real Onett has a badge on its avatar. If a player doesn't see a badge, they should NEVER press E (on PC) or the hand button on mobile (some people may use the badge to make the disguise more accurate).

The Moon Blossom is a Divine, limited, multi-harvest crop that was obtainable from the Lunar Glow Event.
This crop is now unobtainable.
The Moon Blossom tree has a trunk that grow to the side, and then vertical. The trunk is brown and does not split. It has two variants, one of which is light blue colored, while the other is a deep purple. Depending on the color, the tree's canopy will be light blue or purple, and the vines that hang down will mimick the color of the leaves. Moon Blossom crops are in the shape of a flower, similar to that of the Cherry Blossom crop, except they are purple, with four purple stamens that sport glowing anther. The seed is a rectangular shape, vertically positioned, and colored pink (bottom) fading into purple (top).
The Moon Blossom had a 0.5% chance to be obtained from the Night Seed Pack and a 2.5% chance to be obtained from the Premium Night Seed Pack.
The Moon Blossom is one of three blossoms other than Candy Blossom and Cherry Blossom.
There are two possible colors of the Moon Blossom tree: purple and blue.
The Moon Blossom is underwhelming when it comes to the value to rarity ratio, being a 0.5% from the Night Seed Pack yet having a value equal to that of the Moon Mango.
Two plants within the blossom plant variety contain biologically accurate details, such as containing stamens & anther, both used for reproduction. These two plants are the Moon Blossom and Cherry Blossom.
The Moon Blossom had also gotten a fix to its size, as a bug made it so it was covering the majority of the map.

title: Weather
question: O que é Weather no Grow a Garden?
content:
Icons
Grow a Garden features a global weather system with multiple unique weather types, each of which transforms gameplay. These weather events can:
Affect all servers simultaneously:
Every active server experiences the same exact weather at the same exact time.
Exception: The global weather sync only applies to servers made before the weather starts.
Every active server experiences the same exact weather at the same exact time.
Exception: The global weather sync only applies to servers made before the weather starts.
Increase crop growth:
Weather can accelerate growth rates of crops (e.g. Rain & Thunderstorms).
Apply mutations that increase a crop's value immensely.
Weather can accelerate growth rates of crops (e.g. Rain & Thunderstorms).
Apply mutations that increase a crop's value immensely.
Include rare & event-locked mutations:
Certain weather-caused mutations (e.g, Bloodlit, Moonlit) are tied to Events.
Some weather types can only be activated by Grow a Garden administrators.
Certain weather-caused mutations (e.g, Bloodlit, Moonlit) are tied to Events.
Some weather types can only be activated by Grow a Garden administrators.
1 Overview
2 Weather Types
3 Trivia
4 Mutation Gallery
5 Weather Gallery
Standard Weather
Event Weather
Admin Weather
Standard Weather refers to naturally occurring weather in the game and does not require manual activation by an administrator.
Increases crop growth speed by 50%.
50% chance to apply the Wet mutation.
Can combine with Chilled to create Frozen.
Increases growth speed by 50%.
50% chance to apply Wet.
Lightning strikes can apply Shocked mutation.
Increases growth speed by 50%.
Chance to apply Chilled.
Combines with Wet to create Frozen.
Triggers shivering animation for players, along with a shivering sound effect.
25% chance to replace Rain.
Gives crops a glowing purple hue.
Chance to apply Moonlit.
6 crops become Moonlit per night (once every 40 seconds over 4 minutes).
Placing a Night Staff will increase Moonlit crop yield by the amount of charges it has.
Appears every 4 hours and occurs on the 30 minutes of the hour. Lasts 10 minutes.
Soundtrack: Clair De Lune.
Gives crops a glowing red hue.
Chance to apply Bloodlit.
Default: 6 crops become Bloodlit per cycle (once every 40 seconds over 4 minutes).
Placing a Night Staff will increase Bloodlit crop yield by the amount of charges it has.
33.33% chance to replace Night for that cycle.
Lasts 15 minutes.
Both sky and moon turn red.
Meteors fall from the sky.
Crops hit by meteors gain Celestial mutation.
Use Star Caller to direct meteors to crops.
Duration: ~5 minutes.
Event Weather refers to weather that naturally occurs during limited-time Events and does not require manual activation by an administrator.
Spawns bees that visit gardens, generating Pollinated Mutations worth 3x or exchangeable for honey; lasts 10 minutes.
Spawns bees that visit gardens, generating Pollinated Mutations but with x10 Speed Craft and higher Pollinated fruit chance, lasts 10 minutes.
applies the Dawnbound mutation to  4+sunflowers when presented in front of the sun god(jandel). (must be held on hand)
Speeds up growth of Sunflower. (requires confirmation)
A golden Jandel spreading his arm will appear behind the gear shop with a golden god-like aura
Admin Weather refers to weather effects manually triggered by an administrator. These effects do not occur naturally in the game.
Turns the screen rainbow-colored.
Every second, fruits/crops have a chance to receive the Disco mutation.
Forces characters to dance with 1 of 3 default roblox dances.
Duration: 1–2 minutes, Also the duration of the song.
Soundtrack: OIIAI remix (formally Raining Tacos)
Spawns lightning strikes at 4 strikes/second.
A gigantic Jandel entity appears at the start which can be seen behind the gears, cosmetics and eggs shop.
Duration: ~1 minute.
Soundtrack: Beethoven’s "Ode to Joy".
Only activated by Jandel.
Turns the sky yellowish/golden.
Sheckles fall from the sky and can be collected - Avg.: 30 sheckles.
No Mutations are applied to crops.
Duration: 1 or 3 minutes.
Functions similarly to standard Rain.
Replaces the Wet mutation with the Chocolate mutation for crops.
The most recent Chocolate Rain was hosted 1 hour before the Bizzy Bee Event.
Duration: Matches standard rain unless manually altered.
Gives crops the Plasma mutation.
A giant Jandel NPC spawns and has laser eyes which shine to random parts of the map, usually focusing on one singular point, rotating in a circle like pattern.
Also leaves temporary marks on the surface of the map where the laser hit.
Gives crops the Twisted mutation.
A tornado spawns at the center of the map. It moves around the map, granting the twisted mutation to crops that it crosses over. Unreleased
DJ Jhai was shown behind the Pet Eggs and Gear Shop with a DJ booth causing effects and forcing player to dance.
Made every player dance to the "Monster Mash" emote.
Everyone who was in the "Monster Mash" got the Monster Mash Potion Trophy as a reward.
Gives the plants Void Touched mutation.
Plant with this mutation have purple void portals as particle.
Black Hole Weather
Closeup of what the blackhole looks like in the black hole event.
A giant black hole spawns in the middle of the sky and gives the skybox purple effects.
Lowers gravity, giving players a jump boost, and pulls out fruit-effects from the center of the map.
Gives plants the Pollinated mutation.
If Tornado is activated during Bee Swarm, it becomes a Beenado.
Grants from 10 to 100% additional luck to all players for 5 minutes.
It's only feature is to increase the players' luck and does not give any mutations.
This is the only weather, where the sky or the entire map is left untouched.
Make crops have a chance to get Heavenly mutation.
This Weather is not made by Jandel.
Has a likelihood to apply a Molten mutation.
This weather is only spawnable by admins.
This weather gives a warning to all players when it begins.
Thunderstorms have a lightning frequency around 2-3 seconds.
Moonlit, Bloodlit, Zombified, Pollinated, Burnt and Cooked mutations give a notification on the player's screen when the mutation affects a fruit. These are the only mutations to do this.
The alert of volcano is a Reference of Natural disaster survival
Admins have the ability to manually create thunderstorms, though it is only done on special occasions such as ~20 minutes before an update.
After the Lunar Glow Event was released, the first two hours after the event was released, Night occurred every 20 minutes. It was later changed to once per hour
After the Blood Moon update was released, the first two night events were changed to blood moons by an admin.
After the poorly received cosmetics update, the Night and Blood moon weather events were added back until the next update as an apology.
As part of the Bizzier Bees update, Night, Blood moon and Meteor Shower were all made into permanent events that would appear every 4 hours.
Most weather lasts approximately 3-5 mins, with the exceptions of Night (10 minutes), Bee Swarm (10 minutes) and Blood Moon (15 minutes).
According to Playtime Luck Chart, the longer the player stays in-game, the better chance is there for players' fruits to get weather mutations like chilled, frozen, wet, shocked, etc. It can also be increased by the Luck Event.
Sheckle Rain, Jandel Storm, Laser Storm, and Sun God are the only weather types that don't have an icon.
The chances of different weather are not yet confirmed, though by observation:
Rain is the most common weather in the game, appearing almost every 20 minutes.
Frost appears less frequently than Rain, appearing about every hour or so.
Meteor showers are the rarest natural weather type, only occurring once in a few nights.
Rain is the most common weather in the game, appearing almost every 20 minutes.
Frost appears less frequently than Rain, appearing about every hour or so.
Meteor showers are the rarest natural weather type, only occurring once in a few nights.
During a Monster Mash event, the figure behind the DJ Booth is JhaiLatte, a developer of the game.
It takes around 46 seconds during Bee swarm for the bee to pollinate a fruit (Varies depending on how far the targeted fruit is.)
On June 7, 2025, Jandel has stated that the "It's Raining Tacos" song playing during Disco events will be retired and replaced by a new song.
On June 14, 2025, the Disco event made its first appearance with the "O I I A Remix"
On June 14, 2025, the Disco event made its first appearance with the "O I I A Remix"
During the Blackhole event, the low gravity can allow players to scale abnormally large plants that are usually impossible to climb.
The volcano event is based of natural disaster survival
Jandel said he got permission from stickmasterluke, the owner of natural disaster survival

The Candy Blossom is a Divine crop. It is known for its distinctive blocky, candy-like appearance.
The Candy Blossom seed could be purchased for  10,000,000 from the Easter Event Shop with a chance of 4% every restock.
The Candy Blossom can also be obtained from an Admin or Developer.
The Candy Blossom is a tree-like crop with a bright pink trunk, forking into two branches that each display a separate aquamarine-colored canopy. It resembles a fantastical, candy-inspired tree.
The fruit grows along the faces of the canopies, appearing as multi-tiered cotton candy on a white stick. The layers stack vertically, with the largest at the bottom, a pink block, followed by a medium-sized blue block, and topped by a small turquoise block.
The seed features a smooth gradient that transitions from white at the base to blue at the top.
The Candy Blossom was originally obtainable through the Easter Event Shop. After the shop's removal, some older servers had not yet updated, retaining access to it, allowing players to acquire the crop seed beyond the intended event period.
With a minimum sell price of 90,250, the Candy Blossom is the fifth-most valuable crop in terms of single-fruit value in the game, surpassed only by the Dragon Pepper, Sunflower, the Bendboo, and the Mushroom, and tied with the Honeysuckle.
However, many players consider it more lucrative than the Sunflower due to its ability to yield multiple harvests at once and its unlimited weight, unlike the Sunflower's single harvest.
However, many players consider it more lucrative than the Sunflower due to its ability to yield multiple harvests at once and its unlimited weight, unlike the Sunflower's single harvest.
Today, the seed is only obtainable via admin gifts to players.
Its seed is visually similar to Lotus' seed upside down and the blue gradient is a little brighter.

The Celestiberry is a mythical multi-harvest crop obtainable in the Twilight Shop. Its base price is 9,025, though it commonly sells at 40k (at 4.5kg) and sometimes up to 400k (at 18kg).
The Celestiberry appears to be a dark square body conjoined with two branches. The base of the plant is a dark blue bush with a purple spiky vines. This fruit is spiky, which makes it buffed by the Hedgehog and Blood Hedgehog pets.
The Celestiberry is no longer obtainable. It was purchasable during the Night event after Update 1.07.1 in the Twilight Shop for  15,000,000 or 599
Celestiberries with no mutations and no multipliers gain value according to the equation:
BaseValue = max(2500 * x², 9025), where x is the mass of the fruit in kg.
This equation has a max error <6% of real value and approaches 0% as x nears ∞
Celestiberries weighing 1.9 kg or less have the minimum value of  9025.
The Celestiberry was added as part of an apology for the poorly-received Update 1.07.0.
The fruit of the Celestiberry share the same model with the fruit of the Raspberry, and the plant shares the same model with the scrapped Crimson Vine Blood Moon Event crop. The only difference is that the Celestiberry models all use shades of blue.
The plant is the remastered version of the Crimson Vine.
The Celestiberry seed has the 3rd highest price, tied with Ember Lily and behind Moon Mango and Sugar Apple.
The Celestiberry is considered a "Night type" fruit.
When the Berry Blusher Sprinker first released, The Celestiberry was not boosted by it along with the Raspberry. This was fixed in a patch.
The word "celestiberry" is a compound name, where there are 2 words are combined/mixed into one, those words that are combined into celestiberry are Celestial and Berry

The Lotus is a Divine, limited, multi-harvest crop. It was obtainable during the Angry Plant Event.
The Lotus crop has five green leaves at its base. Its body consists of two, circular green pipe-like stems which curve to resemble a stereotypical “X” double helix shape, where the stems would cross once in the middle. Inside the “X” shape, turquoise glowing stalagmite shaped structures protrude from the top and bottom, towards where the pipe-like stems meet in the middle. At the top of the curvature, there is a small, flat, squared shaped green base on which the produce sits in the shape of a pale purple lotus flower. The produce also has two dark purple peduncles protruding from its flower-like shape, each with a large, cube-shaped purple anther at their points. The seed is a small, vertically positioned rectangular shape which fades from sky blue (bottom) to a very pale yellow (top).
The Lotus had a 0.25% chance to be obtained from the Basic Seed Pack, and a 2.5% chance to be obtained from the Premium Seed Pack.
The Lotus was added during the Angry Plant Event.
The Lotus share's similarities with the Moonglow as they both grow only one plant and have a similar base price

Honey is the special event currency introduced in the Bizzy Bees update of Grow a Garden.
Earn  Honey by harvesting pollinated crops, which are crops visited and pollinated by bees during Swarm Events. After harvesting, process these pollinated crops in the Honey Combpressor to convert them into  Honey.

The Hedgehog is a Rare pet added in the Animal Update. It is obtainable during the Lunar Glow Event by giving the Wise Old Owl Moonlit fruit in exchange for 10 (or more) Lunar Points and unlocking the first milestone on the reward track, which will give a player the Hedgehog pet.
It can also be hatched from Night Egg with 49% chance.
The Hedgehog resembles its real-life counterpart, featuring spines along its back.
Occasionally grants Cactus, Durian, Pineapple, Celestiberry, Nectar Thorn and Dragon Fruit a 1.51x size bonus. This trait is stackable, meaning that the more Hedgehogs a player has equipped on their farm, the bigger size will bonus they will get for their prickly fruits.
Hedgehogs are primarily nocturnal, which make them more active at night.
The Hedgehog's trait is stackable.

The Cooked Owl is a mythical pet that was obtainable in the game during the Crafting Update.
The Cooked Owl bears similarities to the Owl. It uses drumsticks in place of wings and its body is entirely brown to present itself as being cooked. There are also smoke particles coming out from the Cooked Owl's head.
Every 15 minutes, 15.35% chance to cook a nearby fruit. Usually Burnt, but occasionally Cooked. All active pets gain an additional 0.17 XP/s.
The Cooked Owl was teased during the release of the Cosmetics Update.
At the time of it being released, players online were given 2 Cooked Owls.
The Cooked Owl is unobtainable from shops.
There is an approximate total of 32m Cooked Owls that exist.
When trying to sell the Cooked Owl, Steven will say, "I see nothing.” indicating that it can’t be sold.
The Cooked Owl exists because of The Wise Old Owl not stocking good stuff causing Jandel to make a joke about turning the Wise Old Owl into a BBQ cosmetic.
At first, Jandel was hesitant to release a Cooked Owl Pet and only gave the community the "Grilled Moonlit Owl" cosmetic, but after some pressure he decided to give the community what they wanted.
The reason Cooked Owl Pet is ranked "Mythical" is because the Owl is also Mythical.

Pets are a core feature added to Grow a Garden in Update 1.04.0.
Pets have unique abilities, having multiple of the same pets can stack their abilities. Players start with 3 equip slots, but can get an additional 5 slots from buying and/or trading aged pets.
Players can hold a maximum of 60 pets in their inventory.
This limit can be bypassed by buying pet eggs instead of hatching them. Keep in mind that to hatch an egg, the player must first delete or sell pets to make space.
These pets can be obtained through normal game play and do not require trading, testing rights, or admin rights.

There are no Unknown Obtainable Pets.
Typically unobtainable, these are pets from previous limited-time events or were never publicly released. Currently, only trading, testing rights, admin rights, or opening their respective eggs, can provide them.

Age is a pet feature which increases over time through XP (to order to increase the Age, It must maintain it's Hunger).
As the pet gets older, the amount of XP required for the pet to age will increase, but it will also improve the pet's trait by either giving it a shorter cooldown, better chances, and other various buffs. A pet cannot age if it's hunger bar reaches 0.
The player can view their pet's age by clicking on the pet and choosing the "view" option, picking it up and stomping on it through their inventory, or pressing the << button on the right side of their screen and viewing the pet menu.
The following table is the XP requirement for a pet to age at different ages.
Each pet has a unique trait, which is a pet feature which can benefit the player and the player's crops. Traits like digging up seeds, increasing crop size, granting mutations to a crop, and much more are all examples of traits. The player can view the trait of a pet by clicking it and choosing the "view" option, where a description can be seen about the pet's trait.
All active pets gain an additional 0.17 XP/s
Every 25 Minutes, a nearby fruit becomes magically pollinated, applying the Pollinated mutation.
Every 30 Minutes, a random pet will refresh its cooldown.
Every 25m, the Tarantula Hawk flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated mutation.
Every 5m, the Tarantula Hawk stings a random pet and advances its ability cooldown by 80s.
Every 30m, the Wasp flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated mutation.
Every 10m, the Wasp stings a random pet and advances its ability cooldown by 60s.
Hunger is a pet feature which is required in order for the pet to grow older. When the hunger bar reaches 0, the pet can no longer grow. To feed a pet, simply equip any crop from the player's inventory and move closer to the player's pet. The player can either click the pet and press the "Feed" option, or hold the interact button that appears once the player gets closer. The player can also feed their pet through the pet menu, by equipping the desired crop to be fed and selecting feed. Once a pet has been fed, a short message will appear showing a percentage by how much hunger has been restored from the player's pet. The mutation and type of fruit depends on how much a pet's hunger has been restored. Each pet can have different hunger bars, which can depend on their rarity. The player can view's the player's pet's hunger by clicking on the pet and choosing the view option, hovering the cursor over the player's pet, or by opening the pet menu by clicking the 2 white arrows on the right side of the screen.

The Bamboo is a single-harvest, legendary crop.
The Bamboo has an invisible truss that allows the player to climb on it, making it a viable way to reach tall plants. Overgrown Bamboo can not be climbed on, because the truss collides with the bamboo.
Bamboo is characterized as tall, light green colored, ringed stems, known as culms. Big Bamboos may also grow branch nodes.
Bamboo seed can be obtained by the following ways:
Has a 20% chance to be in stock in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase a seed for  4,000 or  99.
Normal Seed Pack
Lucky Harvest
Stolen by a Red Fox
Snail, yield a seed when harvest
Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
The Bamboo is the most common legendary seed found in Sam's Shop.
The Bamboo can be used as a ladder for tall or overgrown crops.
If a bamboo gets zombified, it will reveal the hidden truss that allows you to climb it.

The Glowshroom is a limited, multi-harvest and rare crop that was added during the Lunar Glow Event.
The Glowshroom produce is characterized as a neon green, glowing object, which includes the central stalk as the supporting structure and a blocky dome shaped cap.
The Glowshroom crop is a cluster of one big Glowshroom surrounded by smaller harvestable glowshrooms.
A Glowshroom seed can be obtained by rolling via Night Seed Pack for 20% chance or can be obtained from Premium Night Seed Pack for 30% chance.
Shocked Glowshrooms do not look significantly different at all compared to a regular Mushroom.
The Glowshroom is very similar to Lilac, as they both have a base plant that grows their fruits around them.
The main Glowshroom has a small chance of growing a larger or same sized Glowshroom. These have the chance to then become its own "parent" Glowshroom, growing more around it.
The Glowshroom is considered a "Night type fruit"

The Beanstalk is a multi-harvest, Prismatic crop. It was added during the Update Log/1.06.0 update.
A Beanstalk produce is characterized as a pod-like body containing round beans. A Beanstalk crop is characterized as a green climbing vine that reaches significant heights. The crop is covered with green leaves.

Purchasing for  10,000,000 or  715 in the Seed Shop.
Lucky Harvest
Stolen by a Red Fox

The Beanstalk was the first Prismatic crop to be released in-game.
There was a bug when the Beanstalk was first released, where if a player purchased it with Robux, it would instead give them a Dragon Fruit seed.
The in-game Beanstalk is very similar in appearance to the titular beanstalk from Jack and The Beanstalk, being large spiraling plants that sprout podded beans.
The chance to be in the Seed Shop is 1/3,333 (0.03%) which means in 24 hours there will most likely be 8 or 9 in stock on that day.
For some reason, when the crop focus switches from one Beanstock crop to another, the text will be replaced with a rainbow emoji ("🌈") for a fraction of a second.
Contrary to popular belief getting a golden beanstalk from Super Seeds only makes the plant golden, not the fruits

The Bizzy Bee Event is an limited-time event with new features, limited-time NPCs, and rewards.
The Queen Bee tasks users with collecting Pollinated plants in exchange for  Honey.
Users must deposit at least 10kg of these plants into the Honey Combpressor - which is operated by the "Onett" NPC.
After 30 seconds, the user is rewarded with  10.
These points can be redeemed at the Queen Bee's Event Shop for exclusive rewards.
The Queen Bee restocks the honey trades every 30 minutes.
Hourly Swarm Events, lasting for 10 minutes.
The Queen Bee sends swarms of bees to pollinate a number of random plants every 30 seconds.
Replaces the Swarm Event with a 1/3 chance of occurring, also lasting for 10 minutes.
The Queen Bee sends swarms of multi-colored, hard-hat wearing bees to pollinate a number of random plants every 30 seconds.
3 bees are sent to pollinate the players' fruits simultaneously, tripling the amount of pollinated fruits per cycle.
Increases Craft Speed of Bizzy Bear Crafting recipes by 10x.
The user may select which seed or item to craft.
Each crafting recipe has unique requirements, such as a flower pack and 10 honey for a Crafters Seed Pack.
The player must then wait the designated craft time before claiming the item.
The previous iteration of the Bizzy Bear Quest from Part 2 of the event involved giving it specific pollinated or honey-glazed crops of certain sizes, with the required crops becoming harder to obtain as the player progressed through the quests to earn rewards. This system was replaced by the crafting system added in Part 3.

The Giant Ant is a Mythical Pet added in the Animal Update. The Giant Ant can be obtained by hatching the Bug Egg with a chance of 30% to hatch. The Giant Ant has 18,000 hunger.
The Giant Ant has a blue body and head, as well as 6 dark blue legs and an antennae. It has 2 body segments, being a torso and abdomen.
The Giant Ant's first passive trait gives a 10% chance to duplicate a fruit being harvested. The more rare a fruit is, the less likely the fruit is to duplicate.
The Giant Ant's second passive trait gives an extra ~5% chance for candy type plants to be duplicated when harvested.
Upon testing, The Giant Ant gains more hunger points when fed Lilac, as opposed to other fruit.

title: Sell Stuff
question: O que é Sell Stuff no Grow a Garden?
content:
The Sell Stuff Stand (Steven’s Stand)






Type
Stand NPC
Steven’s Stand, also known as the Sell Stuff Stand, is the only location for players to selling crops in Grow a Garden. Its main purpose is for players to sell crops and find out how much the crop is worth. Players can also sell pets here.
1 Overview
2 Appearance
3 Options
4 Trivia
5 Gallery
Steven’s stand is a stand used by players to sell their crops or to see the value of their crops.
Steven's Stand is one of main stands and shops in game alongside the Seed Shop, Gear Shop, and the Pet Eggs shop.
The stand has a red and white awning and is made out of dark brown wood. Inside of it is Steven, who is one of the NPC’s that run the stands. To the right of it, there is a dark wood sign that reads “SELL STUFF” in white text with a black outline.
Upon approaching Steven and pressing 'E' (on keyboard) or tapping the on-screen 'E' button, the following interaction options will appear:
#1 [“I want to sell my inventory”]
This option is used if a player wishes to sell all crops in their inventory (except for favorited fruits). If there are no crops in the player’s inventory, Steven will say “I don’t see anything.” This option will not sell any pets in the players inventory.
#2 [“I want to sell this”]
This option is used if a player wants to sell a singular fruit/pet, which they must be holding when selected. If the player isn't holding a sellable, Steven will say “I don’t see anything.”
#3 [“How much is this worth?”]
This option is used if a player wants to see how much their item is worth. While holding a sellable and selecting this option, Steven will inform the player of how many sheckles it is worth by replying to the player with "I'd value it at (sheckels)¢." If the player is not holding a sellable, Steven will say “I don’t see anything.”
#4 [“Nevermind”]
This option is used if a player accidentally clicks on the 'E' button to Steven, or they change their mind. This causes the interaction between Steven and the player to end, and Steven will reply with "Goodbye!".
Steven's stand is the only stand where items are not for sale.

The Angry Plant Event was released on April 27th, 2025, and ended on May 9th, 2025.
This event featured an animated plant NPC whose name was Jim, with a design that was somewhat similar to the real-life Venus Flytrap plant.
Players were able to receive quests from Jim, which involved bringing him a specific type of crop that also needed to be a specified size. Sometimes the crop was also required to have a specific mutation. By completing Jim’s quests, players filled a progress bar, which required a maximum of 50 quests to complete. Players were rewarded with one Basic Seed Pack per quest they completed, and one Premium Seed Pack upon completion of 50 quests.
See the update log for this event.
Ordered by listing
Ordered by Mutation
When a player approached the Angry Plant and pressed 'E' (on keyboard) or tapped the on-screen 'E' button, it says “Feed me a [Requested Plant] that weights at least [Requested Weight]” and the following interaction options will appear:
“FRIEND???🔥😡”
“frend... with me?? 🥺🥺🥺”
“angry plant always wanted frens... :)”
Jim’s head does not show
The Angry Plant Event was the second ever event to be released in-game.
Jim is a Venus Fly Trap.
At one point, there was a bug which involved Jim’s head not appearing on his body.
The 4th interaction option, "Wanna be friends?", was not available until the last week of the event.
There was a bug where Jim might accept an offering from the player, but no progress was made, and no reward was given to the player. A notification will also pop up as "The Angry Plant stares as you hide your plant in your backpack...".

The Owl is a limited mythical Pet added in the Lunar Glow Event 2025. It could have been obtained by completing the last milestone for the Wise Old Owl.
The Owl resembles its nightly counterpart, but with a white-blue color scheme and a glowing white aura.
The Owl boosts all active pet XP by around 0.20 XP each second. When aging up, the increase goes up by 0.01 XP.
The Owl is one of three Owl types, the other two being the Night Owl and Blood Owl.
Among the 3 owl pets, Owl is the only pet that is mythical.

The Panda is a Legendary pet added in the Animal Update with the only way being able to obtain it was claiming it during the first hour of the event.
The Panda will occasionally sit down every ~20 seconds.
The Panda is white with a black stripe black around its eyes a black tail black feet along with a pair of black ears.
Every ~3 minutes, the Panda goes to a bamboo in the garden and eats it, immediately selling it for a ~1.5x value increase. The player still receives the money after the Panda eats the bamboo. If there's no bamboo in the garden, the Panda will walk around the garden aimlessly.
The Panda gives  0 when sold.
It cannot recognize mutations, so it will sell bamboo with mutations for the same price as a normal bamboo.
The panda was the first pet that couldn't be obtained from an egg.

The Harvest Tool is a Divine rarity gear which harvests all fruits on a selected plant.
It does not destroy plants when used, unlike the shovel.
The Tool has 5 uses.
The Harvest Tool can be obtained by the Gear Shop for  30,000,000.
The Harvest Tool has a yellow-long stalk, surrounded by the end with a white-translucent net, similar to a sieve.
The player can use the Harvest Tool to collect all produce on the player's selected plant. This tool cannot harvest favorited fruits on the plant. The main use of this tool is to harvest from overgrown plants.
The Harvest Tool used to be extremely rare. This was later changed to being guaranteed.
The Harvest Tool is able to get a lucky harvest on the tree the player has clicked it on, but only for non-limited plants.

The Mushroom is a single-harvest, divine crop. This crop was added to Grow a Garden on the Hungry Plant Update.
A Mushroom is characterized as having a central stalk as the supporting structure and a blocky dome-shaped cap with spots. A mushroom can vary in size, including height and width. There are various color variants for Mushroom, including but not limited to its cap, stalk, and spots on the cap.
Mushroom seed can be obtained by the following ways:
Has a 1% chance to be in stock in the Seed Shop. A user can purchase a seed for  150,000 or  249.
Lucky Harvest
Stolen by a Red Fox
Snail, yield a seed when harvest
Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
The various colors of the Mushroom do not affect the Mushroom's sell value in any way.
All colors of the Mushroom are equally common, meaning that there are no "rare" Mushroom colors.
Mushroom when its in stock usually comes with 20 or more seeds to buy, it is a compensation to the single harvest.
Mushroom has the second highest base price in the game, before the Sunflower.
When the Mushroom was first added, it was unable to gain the Shocked Mutation. This was changed the update after it's release.
Mushroom is the only single harvest crop to not exceed the seed price when selling.

The Moonflower is a limited, multi-harvest and legendary crop.
The Moonflower crop appears as an upright shoot similar to that of a young bamboo shoot, but taller. It is a slightly lime green color with several dark green leaves along it. The base of the shoot is slightly thicker than the pinnacle. The Moonflower produce can be found attached to the side of the shoot, and takes on the appearance of a white, bell-shaped flower, with two light yellow stamen. The Moonflower seed fades from white (top) to yellow (bottom), and is a small, vertically positioned rectangle.
The Moonflower can be obtainable in the Night Seed Pack with a 10% chance or 18% chance in the Premium Night Seed Pack.
The Moonflower may be used as a ladder, similar to Tomato and Bamboo.
The Moonflower is considered a "Night type fruit"

The Moon Mango was a limited, multi-harvest Divine crop. It was obtainable during Night in the Twilight Shop.
The Moon Mango crop is tree-like, with an ashy-brown colored trunk and branches, which host canopies that are different shades of dark purple. The Moon Mango crop can be found attached under these canopies, and is similar in appearance to the Mango produce, except it is dark purple, with a singular light purple leaf. The moon mango seed is a small, faded dark purple (top) to extremely light purple (bottom) vertically positioned cuboid.
The Moon Mango could have been obtained during a normal Night weather from the Twilight Shop.
The Moon Mango was added as part of an apology for the poorly-received Update 1.07.0.
The Moon Mango is the most expensive crop in the game.
The Moon Mango is similar to the normal Mango, while being significantly smaller than a typical Mango tree and having a dark purple color scheme.
The Moon Mango is a slow growing crop.
At night event, a Moon Mango will grow faster.
At night event, a Moon Mango will grow faster.
When shoveling a Moon Mango, the text to confirm shows it's mythical, although it is originally divine.
Upon release, the Moon Mango had a base value of  22,563 but then got increased to  45,125 a few days later.
The Moon Mango seed icon in the Twilight Shop and the actual in-game model have different textures.
The Moon Mango Seed got a buff due to backlash caused by it having a high seed price with a low sell price.
The moon mango is known in the GAG community as a 'scam' and a 'meme fruit'
The Moon Mango is considered a "Night type" fruit.

Quests is a mechanic in Grow a Garden where the player can complete certain tasks for Normal Seed Pack(s).
There are 8 possible quests right now.
Quests include planting certain seeds, harvesting certain plants, and earning  Sheckles.
These quests are given and are refreshed every 24 hours. To get to the quests page, the player needs to go to the Gear Shop and select Option 2, ["Show me daily quests"] to view daily quests.
Once the player has completed all of them, the player will get 1-3 Seed Pack(s). The amount of Seed Packs received appears to be equivalent to the amount of Sheckles the player has when the quests are generated.

It's ability is called "Zen Zone".

title: Playtime Luck

content:
1 Overview
2 Luck Progression
3 Mechanics

3.1 Formula
3.2 Example Scenario
3.1 Formula
3.2 Example Scenario
4 Activation Details
5 Trivia
6 Gallery
Playtime Luck is a unique personal event in Grow a Garden that passively enhances crop mutation chances based on the player’s time spent in a single server session. Unlike standard weather events, Playtime Luck is client-bound, meaning it only applies to the individual player who activated it and is not shared across the server.
This event is rare and may trigger shortly after a player joins a server. When active, a four-leaf clover icon appears in the screen corner just like normal weather events. Once triggered, Playtime Luck lasts for the entire duration of the player’s current session.
It increases luck, seed pack luck, the chances of jumbo fruit, and luck with mutations.
As the player continues playing on the same server, their luck increases in stages. Each milestone likely increases the likelihood of crop mutations, synergizing well with other active weather or event conditions.
Playtime Luck increases a player's base drop rate by a percentage depending on how long they’ve remained in the same server. This boost is additive to the base chance, not multiplicative to the total probability.
Adjusted Chance = Base Chance × (1 + Luck Bonus %)
So with +100% Playtime Luck, a 0.5% base chance becomes
0.5% × (1 + 1.00) = 1.0%
Obtaining a 100% luck boost doubles the original base luck (x2).
Trigger Chance: Very low upon server join.
Duration: Active for the entire session once triggered.
Icon: Displays a clover (🍀) in the weather UI slot.
Visibility: Only visible to the player who activated the event.
Playtime Luck is one of the only client-specific events in the game.

Badges (also known as user badges or player badges) are items that serve the function of an achievement, and are generally obtained by visitors to a Roblox experience after fulfilling a certain developer-chosen requirement; for example, via in-experience progression, or by locating an Easter egg.
The game Grow a Garden has 18 badges in the game as of now, all being obtainable.
The "God apple!" badge refers to the Enchanted Golden Apple (also known as a God apple) in Minecraft.
The first 6 badges spell out "GARDEN".
The sprinkler badges, (now except godly) shiny badge, God apple badge, and colorful fruit badge used to be unobtainable. This is likely because of a bug.

Certain Pets - currently only the Moon Cat, Deer,  Spotted Deer and Petal Bee- have the ability where there is a chance that a fruit, of a specific type, are automatically replanted when harvested. This allows the plant to be harvested multiple times within a single growth cycle.
Players can mark fruits in their inventory as 'favourited' - indicated by a small heart icon in the bottom-right corner of the item - to prevent them from being accidentally sold at the Selling Stand.
How to Favorite:
PC: Right-click the item.
Mobile: Double-tap the item.
PlayStation: Press L2.
Xbox: Press LT.
Players can use the Favorite Tool to toggle favorite status on unharvested crops. When activated:
A heart icon appears on the plant.
The player cannot interact with the crop.
The entire plant becomes unremovable.
The mutations cannot be viewed when hovering over the crop.
The favorite status persists through game reloads.
The player can remove the favorite status of a fruit by using the favorite tool on it again.
Favorite tool prevents the player from collecting the fruit, but it will not prevent the fruit from being stolen.
Plants and their fruits may experience overgrowth, affecting their yield, value and efficiency differently:
Plant Overgrowth.
Occurs randomly during the growth stage.
The overgrowth chance of single-harvest plants can be increased by Sprinklers.
Extends growth time.
The price of single-harvest plants can greatly increase dependent on its mass.
Most multi-harvest plants, like fruit trees, maintain a fixed yield of fruit regardless of overgrowth size
Exception: Certain multi-harvest plants (e.g., Tomato Plants, scale their fruit production with overgrowth size

Occurs randomly during the growth stage.
The price of fruit can greatly increase dependent on its mass.
Occasionally, large enough fruits can sink into the ground and become difficult to harvest without a Harvest Tool.

When harvesting plants, there is a small chance to receive a seed of the same plant type as an additional reward. This chance can be increased by using a Snail or other pets that give the same benefits as a Snail.
When harvesting plants, there is a small chance to receive a dupe of the fruit only available throught the Ant or the Giant Ant.
Players can steal crops from other players' gardens for  37. But if the player has a Raccoon, it can steal crops for the player!
Note that if the raccoon steals the crop, the other person won't lose the crop, instead, the raccoon will duplicate the fruit and give it to the player while the other player still has the fruit the player stole.
And Red Fox can only dupe the seed, not the plants, although rare, it doesn't guarantee a steal.
Players can send harvested crops or pets to others using the following controls:
PC: Hold the 'E' key.
Mobile: Hold the Gift button.
Playstation: Hold square.

Likes are free to give and provide no gameplay benefits.

title: Guide
question: O que é Guide no Grow a Garden?
content:
Guide




Grow A Garden Wiki Logo
The Game allows the player to plant, grow, harvest, sell, and gift unique crops to other players.
The player can buy seeds from Sam’s Shop, equipment from the Gear Shop, and pet eggs from the Egg shop.
Special, rare mutations can increase the value of the player's crops. Crops may mutate naturally as they grow, during weather events, or during other events. Frequent events also bring unique and limited seeds, mutations, and other items.
Press E or tap to collect the crops, and sell them for profits.
Different rarities of crops cost more and take longer to grow. Likewise, different rarities of pet eggs cost more and take longer to hatch. But rarer items will grant better rewards!

The Lavender is an uncommon Crop added in the Bizzy Bee Update. It can be obtained in the Honey Shop for  3 Honey or 99 Robux. Only obtainable during the Bizzy Bee Event.
The Lavender plant features three upright green stems, each supporting a column of three to four purple, conical blossoms. The blossoms are symmetrical, smooth in texture, and arranged in a tightly stacked formation along each stem. Each flower is trumpet-shaped with a wide, flared rim and a narrower base, exhibiting a glossy surface that reflects light. The green stems are slender and slightly angled outward from the base, converging at a central point. The overall structure is compact and vertical, with a distinct, repeated floral pattern along each stalk.
The Lavender seed can be obtained by purchasing it from the Honey Shop for a cost of 3 Honey. It is one of several seeds available through the Honey Shop and can be bought using Honey. The Lavender seed appears in quantities of 3 to 4 with a 100% chance per shop refresh, allowing multiple purchases during each cycle.

The Suncoil is a limited, multi-harvest, mythical crop introduced in the third part of the Bizzy Bee event series.
The Suncoil plant has four green stems, two darker green and two lighter green, that extend out of the ground in a slight spiral before connecting onto one larger green part at the top, where the produce itself grows. The Godly Sprinkler is found in the Gear Shop and is one of six sprinklers in the game alongside Basic Sprinkler, Advanced Sprinkler, Master Sprinkler, Chocolate Sprinkler, and Honey Sprinkler.
Upon using it, every crop in the sprinkler's radius will grow faster, as well as increase chances of mutation and bigger growth sizes. This sprinkler lasts for 5 minutes, the same as the lower ranked sprinklers.
Instead of it being circular like its predecessors, it's in a propeller shape. The colors of the sprinkler are lime and black.
This is the best sprinkler in terms of farming  Sheckles and price, though it is rarer than the Advanced Sprinkler.
It doesn't necessarily mean that Advanced Sprinkler is better than Godly Sprinkler in terms of being in stock. This gear can be used on slow-growing crops like Dragon Fruit as an example.

The Blood Moon Event are part of Lunar Glow Event that was added on May 17, 2025.
This Event features the Blood Moon Shop and Blood Moon time alongside with Meteor Showers. During this event, players can explore and farm Bloodlit Fruits to earn exclusive plant mutations.
The Blood Moon has a 33% chance of spawning instead of a normal night, meaning it takes an average of 3 hours or every three nights for a blood moon to spawn.
When spawned, the player's crops have a chance to turn Bloodlit (4x). The Blood Moon also lasts 15 minutes as opposed to the standard 10 for a Night. When the Blood Moon event was launched, the developer started a Global Blood Moon event and the Blood Moon Shop restocked twice, however this does not happen during a normal Blood Moon.
The Night Staff can turn plants Bloodlit at night.
When a Blood Moon starts, an exclusive shop is dug up from the ground and offers brand-new Pets, Night Seed Packs and Eggs, special moon-themed seeds and 2 new gears.

The Sunflower is a limited, divine and multi-harvest crop introduced during the Bizzy Bee Event in Grow a Garden.
It grows one piece of produce at a time. It is the rarest obtainable seed from the Flower Seed Pack.
The Sunflower seed can be obtained at a 0.5% chance from the Flower Seed Pack, which can be purchased from the Honey Shop for  10 or  199.
The Sunflower is the second type of sunflower in the game, the first one being Candy Sunflower.
The Sunflower plant takes approximately 30 minutes to fully grow.
The Sunflower seed is visually very similar to both the Pumpkin,Mango, and Hive Fruit seeds, the Hive Fruit being the most similar.
Upon release, the Sunflower had the highest base price in the game at 200,000, but was later reduced down to 135,000 and then raised back up to  144,000.
The Sunflower has the highest base price in game.
The Sunflower is one of the only plants to have a Mutation exclusive to itself, besides the Sugar Apple, being the Dawnbound mutation, obtainable from the Sun God event.
If a Sunflower gets the Gold and Shocked Mutations, the Sunflower will look like the Dawnbound Mutation.
There is a glitch where sometimes a Sunflower will produce 2 crops.
The Sunflower has a base mass of 15.67kg.
The Sunflower is a easier way to get and has a bigger sell price than the Candy Blossom.
Mutations are listed alphabetically.

3.1 Restrictions
3.2 Examples
3.1 Restrictions
3.2 Examples
Mutations are unique visual transformations that enhance the value of Crops, making them more visually distinctive and often lucrative.
These changes can be triggered by specific in-game conditions like weather, certain tools or special seeds. Certain mutations are significantly rarer than others, but yield a higher  Sheckles multiplier. Most mutations are obtained while growing the plant itself. One mutation, Dawnbound, can only be obtained on the Sunflower. Another growth mutation called Ripe, can only be obtained on the Sugar Apple, which makes the Sugar Apple the only plant with a unique growth mutation.
The following list contains details about all currently released mutations:
Standard
Admin
Unreleased
These mutations occur on naturally and do not primarily require admin activation.
Crops can also turn Gold by Dragonfly.
Crops with 5+ mutations can also turn Rainbow by Butterfly, while removing all other mutations on it.
This mutation can only be applied to Sugar Apples.
These mutations do not occur on naturally and do primarily require admin activation.
This mutation can only be applied to Sunflowers.
These mutations cannot be obtained through standard gameplay and require admin-rights or testing-rights to receive.

Where:
Mass = The mass, in kilograms, of the fruit

Growth Mutation, one of:

Rainbow (×50)

Mutation Amount = Amount of unique environmental mutations applied
Only one of either Golden or Rainbow can be applied.
Only one of either Chilled, Wet, Frozen or Molten can be applied.

The Queen Bee is a Divine pet added in the Bizzy Bee Event update. It can be obtained in the Bee Egg for 18 or 129. It has 65,000 hunger.
The Queen Bee's head shares the same model as the Bee pet. However, it is much larger and it has blush on its face and wears a crown on its head, and has a larger abdomen. It is identical in appearance to the NPC Queen Bee.The crown is almost identical to the coats of New Zealand crown.
Every ~25 Minutes, a nearby fruit becomes magically pollinated, applying the Pollinated mutation.
Every ~25 Minutes, the pet with the highest cooldown will refresh its ability.
The Queen Bee's For The Queen Ability (Refresh Cooldown) was buffed during the Working Bee update.
For the Queen's Cooldown went from ~30 Minutes to ~25 Minutes. The mechanics was also changed from Random Pet to Pet with the Highest Cooldown.
Queen Bee can refresh another Queen Bee's For the Queen Ability, resulting in a potentially endless loop. It can only stop when there is another pet with a higher cooldown, or when the Queen Pollinator ability is refreshed instead.
When holding the Queen Bee, the crown will occasionally sparkle with the same effect as celestial.

The Gear Shop, also known as Eloise's Gear Shop, or Eloise's Shop is one of the main shops in the game, where various gear can be purchased using sheckles.
It is found at one of the sides of the game area, at the opposite side of the Seed Shop and the Sell Stuff stand and is to the right of the Cosmetics Shop.
The initial gear stock in the shop is the same throughout all servers, and changes every 5 minutes, giving a new selection of gear to purchase from.
The stand features a green-and-white horizontally striped awning over a dark-brown wooden frame. Above the awning is a thin rectangular prism made from dark-brown wood with green, black-outlined letters displaying "GEAR". Inside, is Eloise, the stand’s owner. About four studs up and to the left, a dark-wood sign is tilted at a 45° angle, its white, black-outlined lettering displaying “GEAR SHOP”.
Options found in Eloise's Shop
When a user approaches Eloise and press 'E' (on keyboard), the square on PlayStation, or tap the on-screen button on mobile, Eloise will then say "Welcome to my stand!", and the 3 following interaction options will appear:
When this option is selected, Eloise will respond with “Here is the gear shop”.
After that, the Gear Menu opens on the player’s screen, showcasing the full range of available gears. This is primarily used when the player wants to know what is in stock and attempts to buy the gears in stock.
When this option is selected, the daily quests menu pops up on the player’s screen.
It allows players to view their current quests and track their progress, completing all three daily quests awards a Normal Seed Pack. Players can use this menu both to claim their free seed pack and to monitor how far they’ve progressed toward each daily quest.
When this option is selected, Eloise will respond with “…” and all three interaction choices will close, ending the interaction between the player and Eloise.
This is primarily used when a player changes their mind or accidentally opened the interaction menu.
The Gear Menu
(Refer to the Gears page to find out about more gears)
The Daily Quests Menu
In the Daily Quests section of Eloise’s Shop, there are 8 possible quests, of which 3 are randomly selected each day. Completing all 3 active quests rewards players with 1–3 Normal Seed Pack(s). These quests are the following:
Earn 25,000 Sheckles
Harvest 100 Blueberries
Harvest 50 Strawberries
Harvest 25 Apples
Harvest 3 Dragon Fruit
Plant 5 Watermelon Seeds
Plant 5 Pumpkin Seeds
Plant 100 Carrot Seeds
The Easter Shop
Eloise is the only current female NPC that holds her own shop. The shop disappeared after the end of the Easter Event 2025.
The name "Eloise" is the only one among the five main NPCs (Raphael, Sam (Seed Shop), Sam (Cosmetics Shop), Steven, and Eloise) that starts and ends with a vowel!
The most expensive item in the Gear Shop with the in-game currency of  Sheckles is the Harvest Tool, going at a price of  30,000,000. With the currency of  Robux, it is the Master Sprinkler, with  199.
The cheapest item in the Gear Shop with the in-game currency of  Sheckles is the Basic Sprinkler, going at a price of  25,000. With the currency of  Robux, it's both the Watering Can and Friendship Pot with  39.

The Bee is a common pet introduced in the Bizzy Bee Event update. There is a 65% chance of hatching it from the Bee Egg, which can be purchased for  18. The Bee has 25,000 hunger.
The Bee's model resembles the Honey Bee and Disco Bee, but features a mostly yellow body with black stripes, black antennae, and light gray wings.
Every 24:45m, the Bee flies to a nearby fruit and pollinates it, applying the Pollinated Mutation. When pollination occurs, the following message appears: Bee applied Pollinated mutation to the [Fruit].
The following foods fill Bee's hunger by large increase. The Bee prefers flowers type foods. Mutated food versions increase the amount of hunger points.
Rose (Around 10%)
Pink Lily (Around 60%)

title: Shops
question: O que é Shops no Grow a Garden?
answer: (Please check the page of a respective shop for more information on them!)
content:
(Please check the page of a respective shop for more information on them!)
There are several types of shops that serve different purposes for players to progress and customize their garden. Here's a breakdown of the main shops:
Seed Shop:
Purpose: This is where players primarily purchase seeds to plant in their garden.
NPC: Run by an NPC named Sam. Interacting with him directly opens the seed shop menu.
Stock: The stock of seeds refreshes every 5 minutes in real-time and is the same for all players on a server. The variety and rarity of seeds available can change with each restock.
Features: Players can view the available seeds, their rarity, cost, and the number currently in stock. There's also a "Restock" button that allows players to instantly refresh the stock for 79 Robux, though this is unnecessary due to the frequent automatic restocks. Players can also gift seeds to others through the interaction menu.
Location: Found on one side of the game's island, with a white striped awning.
Purpose: This is where players primarily purchase seeds to plant in their garden.
NPC: Run by an NPC named Sam. Interacting with him directly opens the seed shop menu.
Stock: The stock of seeds refreshes every 5 minutes in real-time and is the same for all players on a server. The variety and rarity of seeds available can change with each restock.
Features: Players can view the available seeds, their rarity, cost, and the number currently in stock. There's also a "Restock" button that allows players to instantly refresh the stock for 79 Robux, though this is unnecessary due to the frequent automatic restocks. Players can also gift seeds to others through the interaction menu.
Location: Found on one side of the game's island, with a white striped awning.
Gear Shop:
Purpose: This shop sells various tools and items ("Gear") that provide benefits for gardening tasks, such as speeding up growth, moving plants, and increasing mutation chances. It also offers daily quests.
NPC: Run by an NPC named Eloise.
Stock: The gear stock refreshes every 5 minutes, and the availability of items depends on their rarity. A manual restock is available for 79 Robux, though this is unnecessary due to the frequent automatic restocks.
Location: Found on the opposite side of the garden island from the Seed Shop and Sell Stuff Stand, with a green and white striped awning and a "Gear Shop" sign. It's at the left side of the Cosmetic's Shop.

Pet Egg Shop:
Purpose: Players can buy pet eggs here, which hatch into pets that provide various bonuses to gardening. Players can also sell pets here and get information about pet aging and traits.
NPC: Run by Raphael.
Stock: The Pet Egg Shop's stock refreshes every 30 minutes.
Interaction: Talking to Raphael provides options to buy pet eggs, sell pets, inquire about a pet's worth, learn about pet aging, and view pet information (including egg rarity and trading pets for extra slots).
Location: Found the right side of the Cosmetics Shop, with a yellow and white striped awning.

Cosmetics Shop:
Purpose: This shop allows players to purchase decorative items to customize their garden's appearance.
NPC: Run by Sam (Separate NPC from Sam from the Seed Shop).
Stock: The cosmetic shop's stock refreshes every 4 hours.
Features: Players can buy various decorative items.
Location: Situated between the Gear Shop and the Pet Egg Shop.

Pet Eggs can be purchased from Pet Eggs shop, which refresh every 30 minutes.
Hatching eggs is required in order to obtain a pet (with a few exceptions such as the Panda and Blood Owl). A player can hatch an egg by equipping an egg from their inventory and placing it on any space of their plot. Then, the player waits until the egg hatches.
The player can speed up the process by choosing to skip its growth which costs  Robux, or the player can use pets that decrease the hatch time such as Chickens, Roosters, or Blood Kiwis. The player can only hatch 3 eggs at a time at minimum and can be increased by buying in the shop with  Robux and/or trading aged pets, where the player can add up to 5 extra slots.
To obtain pets, players need to buy eggs. These eggs cannot be gifted and can be obtained through normal gameplay. Each egg has a chance to give different pets and so make sure to check out the eggs first.

The Venus Fly Trap is a Divine, limited, multi-harvest crop. It was available during the Angry Plant Event.
The Venus Fly Trap crop has a long, thick green stem with a beak-like head sitting at the top, facing at a slight downwards angle. There are two large, green leaves at the base of the crop, with two yellow spikes or thorns on the stem of each leaf. There are several larger yellow spikes along the back of the thick base stem, leading up to the head. The beak-like head has rows of teeth-like shapes which are green with minor yellow rims. Inside the beak-like head is a reddish color, visible beyond the teeth. The produce is a dark and light purple striped ball-shaped blocky figure, with several large orange spikes or thorns protruding from it in seemingly random places.
The Venus Fly Trap had a 0.01% chance to be obtained from the Basic Seed Pack and a 1% chance to be obtained from the Premium Seed Pack.
The Venus Fly Trap is a reference to Plants vs Zombies Chomper.
The Venus Fly Trap’s crops can appear in multiple shaded variants.
Jim the Angry Plant is a Venus Fly Trap.

title: Lucky Harvest
question: O que é Lucky Harvest no Grow a Garden?
answer: When a player harvests a fruit, there is a small chance that a lucky harvest will occur, which gives the player the seed of the harvested plant. It's possible to get rare seeds from a lucky harvest such as Beanstalk and Ember Lily. The seed will despawn after 30 seconds if not collected. Seeds dropped from a lucky harvest will begin to float on the ground and follow the player.
content:
When a player harvests a fruit, there is a small chance that a lucky harvest will occur, which gives the player the seed of the harvested plant. It's possible to get rare seeds from a lucky harvest such as Beanstalk and Ember Lily. The seed will despawn after 30 seconds if not collected. Seeds dropped from a lucky harvest will begin to float on the ground and follow the player.
Players can get lucky harvests from stealing fruits, though it's very rare.
The player can only get Seed Shop plants from lucky harvest.
Harvesting many fruits in a row increases the chance of a lucky harvest.

The Hive Fruit is a limited, divine crop which was introduced in the Bizzy Bee Event.
The Hive Fruit has recently been buffed - making the Hive Fruit one of the best fruits in the game at this time.
The Hive Fruit seed can be obtained exclusively from the Honey Shop by trading  40 or by paying  599.
Once planted, the Hive Fruit tree occupies a significant area in the garden, similar to the Moon Blossom. It features outward-growing branches, with fruits appearing on these extensions. The appearance of the tree is similar to a peach tree.
Its unique tree structure requires strategic garden planning to maximize yield.
It is one of the 4 plants that are purchasable in the Honey Shop as a seed.
The Hive Fruit grows differently than other plants. As the Hive Fruit grows, it starts off small, then its size gradually increases as it grows. This is different because most fruit extend or add more parts as it grows.
Sometimes the Hive Fruit can stay extremely small while growing, this makes it very difficult to harvest without the use of a harvest tool.
Hive Fruit is currently the plant with the most changes in base value. Starting off with 6,400 , after the Bizzy Bees Update 2 days it got changed to 23,145. A few days later it got buffed to 45,125 . As of the Working Bees Update, the base value of Hive Fruit is once again changed to 55,955
As of Update 1.10.0 the Hive Fruit's unique ability to release bees when it has the Pollinated mutation has been properly implemented, as it was broken in prior versions.

The Cherry Blossom is a Divine, multi-harvest crop.
The Cherry Blossom crop takes the appearance of a tree with a brown trunk and branches. The trunk splits into to branches, with a canopy on either branch. The color of the canopies is pink. The produce is also pink, imitating the shape of a small real-life Cherry Blossom or Sakura flower with three stamen in the middle. The seed is a rectangular shape, vertically positioned, and also pink.
Before April 21st, 2025, players could purchase a Strawberry from the Seed Shop for 21 Robux to obtain the Cherry Blossom seed. The Cherry Blossom seed has not returned, and is currently unobtainable.
The Cherry Blossom crop is based off the blossoms of the Cherry Tree, often referred to as “Sakura” in Japan, originating from China.
The Cherry Blossom may have inspired the Petal Bee's color scheme.
The produce is similar to the Moon Blossom.
This is likely because both are blossoms.
This is likely because both are blossoms.

The Rainbow Sack is a seed pack that gives the player an opportunity to receive one of different seeds with the permanent Rainbow trait. It was first introduced in the update 1.03.0.
The Rainbow Sack shares the same mechanic as the Super Seed.
The Rainbow Sack could be obtained from Basic Seed Pack with a 0.005% chance or from Premium Seed Pack with a 0.5% chance during Angry Plant Event or from Exotic Flower Seed Pack with 1% chance during the first and second parts of the Bizzy Bee Event.
Now, the Rainbow Sack can be obtained from the Exotic Crafters Seed Pack with a 1% chance during the third part of the Bizzy Bee Event — the Crafting Update.
