The Cleaning Spray is a gear added in the Crafters Update. It has multiple variations.
The Cleaning Spray is a handheld gun with a slender barrel, a wide nozzle and a fluid reservoir positioned before the start of the barrel.
The Cleaning Spray can be acquired from the Gear Shop for  15,000,000.
When using Cleaning Spray, it removes all mutations from the crop it was used on. It can also be used to craft the shocked, choc, and pollinated mutation sprays. It does not remove Gold or Rainbow mutations.
Cleaning Spray is the second gear to have variants, the first being sprinklers.

title: Seed Shop
question: O que é Seed Shop no Grow a Garden?
content:
Seed Shop






Type
Shop NPC
1 Overview
2 Appearance
3 Available Seeds
4 Trivia
5 Gallery
The Seed Shop or Sam's Shop is where players can purchase the majority of crop seeds available in the game. The seeds can either be bought with Sheckles or Robux.
It operates on a stock system, meaning that not all crop seeds are consistently available at all times. However, there are notable exceptions: Carrot, Strawberry, Blueberry and Tomato seeds are always guaranteed to be available.
The stock refreshes every 5 minutes, giving a chance for seeds that were previously unavailable to become available. The rarer the seed is, the less likely it will be available in the shop.
Stockings on the Seed Shop are shared globally across all servers, meaning all players are seeing the same stock. However, the purchases of one player do not affect the stock for others, as the act of purchasing is entirely client-sided.
Players can always purchase a restock for  79, refreshing the shop instantly without having to wait the 5-minute timer. It should be noted that it is  79 per purchase, and not a gamepass.
Sam’s Shop is one of the shops found in the game alongside the Gear Shop, Pet Eggs, and Cosmetics Shop. If a player hovers over a seed, it will start growing while shaking then become the Fruit it produces
Developers of the game can restock on the Seed Shop using admin commands.
The Seed Shop is a small stall covered with a white and blue striped cloth. Behind the stall is an interactable NPC named Sam. He wears a straw hat and a farmer's trousers.
Restock Interval: The shop's inventory refreshes every 5 minutes, offering a new selection of seeds for purchase.
Common Seeds: Typically low-cost seeds that yield basic crops.
Uncommon Seeds: Slightly rarer seeds with moderately priced crops.
Rare  Seeds: Seeds that are less frequently available and produce higher-value crops.
Legendary Seeds: High-value seeds that are quite rare and yield significant profits.
Mythical  Seeds: Very high-value seeds that produce valuable crops, often with special traits.
Divine Seeds: Extremely rare seeds, offering unique and highly valuable crops.
Prismatic Seeds: Rarest seeds in-game currently, one-of-a-kind crops.
Players are only able to have 800 seeds on their plot, as of June 1st 2025.
Admins can restock a particular seed in the seed stock, available by having testing or admin rights.

The Lunar Glow Event was a limited-time event in Grow a Garden that introduced new features, an exclusive NPC, and rewards.
The event featured the Wise Old Owl NPC, who tasked users with harvesting Moonlit, and later, Bloodlit, plants. The theme drew inspiration from the night cycle and nocturnal imagery. The event was extended by one week after community backlash for Update 1.07.0 - The Lunar Glow Event officially ended May 31, 2025.
Users were tasked with finding Moonlit crops and exchanging them for Lunar Points at the Wise Old Owl.
The Lunar Points per plant were dependent on its tier and certain mutations.
Points were then used to fulfill a list of milestones that awarded a set of items.
Once the last milestone was reached, the player could reset the quest for  500 or  500,000,000. (used to be 1,000,000,000)
Hourly Night Events occurred every hour at XX:00, lasting for 10 minutes.
During Night, plants gained the Moonlit mutation.
The Meteor Shower was introduced in Update 1.06.0. Crops hit with falling meteors would be given the Celestial mutation.
The Blood Moon was released in Update 1.06.0, which had a 1 in 3 chance to replace regular Night events.
This event brought the Bloodlit mutation with it, which offered extra Lunar Points when exchanged with the Wise Old Owl.
The Meteor Shower was introduced in Update 1.06.0. Crops hit with falling meteors would be given the Celestial mutation.

See full update log for the final version here.
The Lunar Glow Event was removed on May 24, 2025 (Update 1.07.0) but was later readded back on the same day in Update 1.07.1.
The Wise Old Owl appears to be a male.
The Lunar Glow Event was the third Event added in Grow a Garden.
It was the first Event to have and feature a different currency as obtainment needs.
During the last hours before the Bizzy Bee Event Update, Jandel stated that the Wise Old Owl would later reappear cooked in a BBQ. A Grilled Moon Owl cosmetic was then given out to all players during the last few hours before the Bizzier Bees Update, with plans of releasing it as a pet for everyone (being found here).
This was due to him activating two consecutive Nights at the time and both of the Twilight Shops having a "bad" stock.
This was due to him activating two consecutive Nights at the time and both of the Twilight Shops having a "bad" stock.
The night event is still present as of now, but instead of happening every hour, its starts every 4 hours and 30 minutes.

The Raccoon is a limited divine Pet added in the Lunar Glow update. It could be obtained by hatching the Night Egg with a chance of 0.1%, or the Exotic Night Egg at a 1% chance. The Raccoon has 45,000 hunger.
The Raccoon is very similar to its real-life counterpart, except more blocky and with simplified details.
Every 15 minutes, the Raccoon goes to another player's plot and duplicates their fruit, then gives it to the pet owner. If the same fruit is duped, its value is nerfed by 1% or 0.5% value based on its KG
The Raccoon has a somewhat similar trait as the Red Fox, guaranteed to reward the player a plant, including event exclusive plants, while the Red Fox duplicates seeds from only the Seed Shop.
An image of the raccoon is added to the game "Murder Mystery 2" as a cameo.
The raccoon and the red fox are the only pets to directly interact with other players' gardens.

The Friendship Pot gear was released in Update 1.09.0.
The Friendship Pot is a Divine gear that is obtainable from the Gear Shop for  15,000,000 or  39.
The Friendship Pot is a brown, medium-sized square pot filled with dirt. If the player or the player's friend tends to the plant, it grows through different stages.
Only one pot is needed for two players. When gifted to another player, the gifter and the receiver will recieve a linked pot with the other's name. To use it, both players need to tend to each other's plants every 24 hours. Players cannot place multiple pots linked to the same person.
A garden can have a maximum of 4 linked pots placed down, and currently cannot be picked up, or moved. Can be destroyed.
The Friendship Pot has multiple stages that evolve as the player and their friend tend to it and their streak increases. (W.I.P. on getting every stage).
The Friendship Pot is the first gear that requires the attention of two players.
This is the only gear that doesn’t have limited uses or a certain time before being destroyed, instead it’s permanent unless deleted.
If a player links a pot to someone they already have a linked pot placed down with, they will receive another linked pot that will be stuck in their inventory.
If a streak is ended, the player can join their friend to reset it back to 0.

The Moth is a legendary Pet introduced in the Friendship Update.
The Moth has 25.000 hunger.
The Moth can be obtained from the Anti Bee Egg, which can be bought from the Limited Time Shop for  149 or crafted at the Bizzy Bear for:
25 Honey + 1x Bee Egg = 1x Anti Bee Egg
It is a light blue color with large black square eyes and a small smiling mouth. It has two short black antennae on top of its head, four stubby legs, and a pair of long translucent wings. Looks something like a honeybee just a grey variant and a smaller body.
Every ~13 minutes, restores 100% hunger of a random pet by singing to it.
Having two active moths can totally restore the entire pets' hunger so they don't have to be fed anymore.

The Nectar Staff is a honey gear that can be used to attract more bees when placed
It will attract more bees to pollinate more fruits in the players garden, it has a limit of 8 attractions.
The player can obtain the Staff of Nectar from a quest or buy the Nectar Staff for  25  or for 219 at any time.
The heading of the Nectar Staff is the same as the Honey Comb cosmetic.

title: Super Seed

content:
Super Seed






Price
Minimum  37 in the Forever Pack


Obtainable?

The Super Seed is a unique seed which is only obtained in the Forever Pack.
When a player plants the Super Seed, it becomes any non-exclusive plant with an increased chance of receiving a permanent Golden or Rainbow plant trait. Both of them greatly increase the mutation rate of plants, depending on their trait.
The Super Seed is available exclusively through the Forever Pack with  Robux. It is not obtainable through regular gameplay or farming methods.
The Super Seed is the oldest seed that was added to the game.
Users could get 9 Super Seeds from the Super Seed Pack before the Easter Event 2025.

The Grape is a multi-harvest, Divine crop.
The Grape produce is characterized as clusters of round bodies joined together with a small green stem.
Grape seed can be obtained by the following ways:
A user can purchase a seed for  850,000 or  599.
Lucky Harvest
Stolen by a Red Fox
Snail, yield a seed when harvest
Rarely dug up by a Dog or Golden Lab
The Grape, the Mushroom, the Pepper, and the Cacao are currently the only non-limited Divine crops.
There was once a bug where the Grape could not mutate as shocked. This was patched in an update.
An overgrown Grape vine can enter another player's garden.
Grape is the first Divine Seed in the Seed Shop and was introduced in the first update in the game along with the Easter event.
Mutations are listed alphabetically.

The Honey Sprinkler is a divine gear available in the Bizzy Bee Event. It is extremely similar to the Chocolate Sprinkler and can be purchased for  30 when it is in stock in the Honey Shop, or  199 at any time.
The Honey Sprinkler has an appearance similar to the Godly Sprinkler, except it has a jar of honey on top, has four heads, and is mainly yellow.
When placed, the Honey Sprinkler applies the Honey Glazed mutation to all produce in its range for the next 1 minute (it will apply the mutation to all crops on a plant if the plant is in the range). There's no matter if growing or fully grown plants are within its radius - every plant gains the mutation "HoneyGlazed". ==
The Honey Sprinkler is the 2nd sprinkler exclusive to an event, the 1st being the Chocolate Sprinkler. Yet, it is the 1st Divine exclusive sprinkler.

The Golden Lab is a common pet added in the Update 1.04.0. It can be obtained by hatching the Common Egg with a chance of 33.33%. The Golden Lab has 1,000 hunger. Every few minutes, it naps for about 3 - 4 seconds.
The Golden Lab is a recolor of the Dog, having brown ears and a beige body, and lacks spots on its body & face.
Every 60 seconds, the Golden Lab will attempt to dig up a random seed that can be found in the Seed Shop, with a 10% chance to succeed.

The Kiwi is a Rare Pet added in the Lunar Glow update. It will automatically be given with no additional cost to the player upon reaching 160 Lunar Points in the Lunar Glow Event.
The Kiwi is a bird with a brown body and head, that has a yellow beak and feet along with black eyes.
The Kiwi's' passive is to go to the egg with the highest remaining hatch time and sing above it, making it decrease the egg's time by 25 seconds every minute.
However, the Kiwi will not do anything if there are no eggs on the player's plot or the eggs have no remaining time left, rendering it useless.
